course_main_structural_unit.address:
Raja 31
50417 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Includes overview of psychopathology, aetiology, diagnosis, possibilities of treatment and prevention of mental disorders. Study course consists of two modules: clinical psychology and psychiatry.
description.et: Antakse teoreetilisi teadmisi ja praktilisi oskusi olulisemate psüühikahäirete levikust, etiopatogeneesist, diagnostikast, ravist ning rehabilitatsioonist. Kursus hõlmab ka psühholoogiateaduste kliinilise rakendamise võimalusi. Ainekursus koosneb kahest alamoodulist: kliiniline psühholoogia ja psühhiaatria.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide knowledge of the prevalence, aetiology, pathogenesis, symptoms, course, assessment, treatment as well as service organisation and possibilities for prevention of major mental disorders.
objectives.et: Anda teadmised olulisemate psüühikahäirete levikust, etiopatogeneesist, avaldumisviisidest, kulust, diagnostikast, ravikorraldusest ja ravist ning ennetamise võimalustest.

learning_outcomes.en: - knows contemporary research results of the prevalence and factors affecting the risk, causes and course of mental disorders;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab kaasaegsete uuringute tulemusi psüühikahäirete levimuse, riskitegurite, tekkepõhjuste ja kulgu mõjutavate asjaolude kohta;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the psychological models of mental and psychosomatic disorders, and is able to explain the cognitive models of anxiety and psychosomatic disorders;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab psüühikahäirete ja psühhosomaatiliste häirete psühholoogilisi mudeleid, oskab seletada  ärevushäirete ja psühhosomaatiliste häirete kognitiivseid mudeleid;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the diagnostic criteria of common mental disorders;
- is able to collect information about patient's symptoms, history of mental disorders and life history;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab koguda informatsiooni patsiendi kaebuste, haigus- ja eluanamneesi kohta;

learning_outcomes.en: - can explore and describe the mental status of patients; is able to recognise psychiatric conditions requiring emergency treatment;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab hinnata ja kirjeldada psüühilist seisundit, sealhulgas ära tunda vältimatut psühhiaatrilist abi vajavad patsiendid;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the methods and aims of psychological assessment in different medical settings;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab meditsiinis kasutatavaid psühholoogilisi hindamismeetodeid ja nende kasutamise eesmärke;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the possibilities of prevention, evidence based treatment and service organisation of mental disorders, knows the treatment principles and guidelines of major mental disorders;
learning_outcomes.et: - teab psüühikahäirete ennetamise, tõenduspõhise ravi ja ravikorralduse võimalusi,  olulisemate psüühikahäirete ravipõhimõtteid ja ravijuhiseid;

learning_outcomes.en: - understands the nature of evidence-based psychotherapy and knows the major schools of psychotherapy;
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab tõenduspõhise psühhoteraapia olemust ja tunneb peamisi psühhoteraapia koolkondi;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the principles of interpersonal communication, and is acquainted with skills supporting the interaction with the partner;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb suhtlemise seaduspärasusi ja vestluspartnerit toetavaid suhtlemisviise;

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to use interviewing skills, including skills for active listening;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab kasutada intervjueerimise, sealhulgas aktiivse kuulamise oskusi;

learning_outcomes.en: - can impart information in a manner that enables patients to promote their health;
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab edastada patsiendile informatsiooni viisil, mis aitab patsiendil edendada oma tervist;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows laws that regulate the treatment and rehabilitation of persons with mental disorders;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb psüühikahäiretega isikute ravi ja rehabilitatsiooni reguleerivaid seadusi;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the ethical principles of working with people and problematic relationships that may arise in helping professions;
learning_outcomes.et: - tunneb inimestega töötamise eetilisi põhimõtteid ja probleemseid suhteid;

learning_outcomes.en: - understands the nature and contributing factors of professional burnout;
learning_outcomes.et: - mõistab professionaalse läbipõlemise olemust ja soodustavaid tegureid;

learning_outcomes.en: - knows the specific psychological features of working with children.

independent_work.et: Working through the learning materials in Moodle before the seminars. Completion of Personality Test. Analysis of a problem situation using the ABC model according to RET principles. One presentation in clinical psychology and at least one presentation in psychiatry. Preparation for the debate "All suicides of children and adolescents are preventable" in seminar "Affective disorders in children and adolescents. Suicidality and self-aggression".

description.et: Multiple-choice exam
Debate "All suicides of children and adolescents are preventable" in seminar "Affective disorders in children and adolescents. Suicidality and self-aggression" (guidelines in Moodle)
One passed seminar report in psychiatry
One passed seminar report in clinical psychology

grade_preconditions.et: The participation of contact learning at least 80% (groups' participation sheets must be handed over on the last day of study before the exam day). The passed seminar reports. Participation in the debate.

grade_evaluation.et:
Result of the test on clinical psychology and psychotherapy accounts for 1/3; result of the exam on psychiatry accounts for 2/3.
F: percentage of correct answers - 50% and less
E: percentage of correct answers - 51% to 60%
D: percentage of correct answers - 61% to 70%
C: percentage of correct answers - 71% to 80%
B: percentage of correct answers - 81% to 90%
A: percentage of correct answers - 91% to 100%

debt_elimination.et: With students of the next scheduled practical training cycle.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Psychiatry:
1a. J. Lönnqvist, M. Heikkinen, M. Henriksson, M. Marttunen, T. Partonen (toim.). Psühhiaatria. Tõlge eesti keelde. Medicina, 2000, 663 lk. või
1b. Kaplan and Sadock's synopsis of psychiatry: behavioral sciences, clinical psychiatry. H.I. Kaplan, B.J. Sadock, J.A. Grebb - 7th ed. 1257 lk.
2. RHK-10. Psüühika- ja käitumishäired. Kliinilised kirjeldused ja diagnostilised juhised. MTO (Tõlge eesti keelde), Tartu, 1993, 332 lk (kordustrükid 1996,1999 või elektrooniline versioon).

Clinical psychology and psychotherapy:
1. Deary V, Chalder T, Sharpe M. (2007) The cognitive behavioural model of medically unexplained symptoms: a theoretical and empirical review. Clinical Psychology Review, 27(7),781-797
2. Krips, H. Suhtlemisoskustest õpetamisel ja juhtimisel. Tartu ülikooli Kirjastus, 2003. Lk. 70-101.
3. Lönnqvist J., Heikkinen M., Henriksson M., Marttunen M., Partonen T. (toim.). Psühhiaatria. Tõlge eesti keelde. Medicina, 2000, 663 lk. Lk. 125-127 (depressiooni kognitiivne seletus), 173-176 (paanikahäire psühholoogilised teooriad), 597-628 (Psühhoteraapiad).
4. Wells, A. (2007) Cognition About Cognition: Metacognitive Therapy and Change in Generalized Anxiety Disorder and Social Phobia. Cognitive and Behavioral Practice 14, 18-25.
5. Andrade, B., Ugalde, O. (2011) Ethical self-evidence and the principle of proportionality: Two fundamental ethical principles applied to a psychiatric case report. Ethical Human Psychology and Psychiatry, 13(1), 29-46.
resources.recommended_materials:
Clinical psychology and psychotherapy:
1. Alhainen, K., Erkinjuntti, T., Rinne, J. Mäluhäired. Tallinn: Medicina, 2005, 160 lk.
2. Allik, J.; Realo, A.; Konstabel, K. (Toim.) (2003). Isiksusepsühholoogia. Tartu: Tartu Ülikooli Kirjastus
3. Butler, G. Võit sotsiaalärevuse ja häbelikkuse üle. Kognitiiv-käitumisteraapia. Tänapäev, 2006.
4. Davison,G.C., Neale, J.M. Abnormal psychology. Revised 6th ed. New York etc.: Wiley, 1996, 811 P., (1994.).
5. Gleitman, H., Reisberg, D., Gross, J. (2004/2007) Psychology. 7th ed. New York; London : Norton.
6. Hawton K., Salkovskis P.M., Kirk J., Clark D.M. Psühhiaatriliste probleemide kognitiivne käitumisravi (Praktiline käsiraamat). (Tõlge eesti keelde). Fontes PMP, 1993. 522 lk.
7. Ellis, A. Kuidas saada jagu oma ärevusest. Tallinn: Varrak, 2000.
8. Mõttus, R., Allik, J., & Realo, A. (Toim.) (2011). Intelligentsuse psühholoogia. Tartu: Tartu Ülikooli Kirjastus.
9. Tähkä, V. Psühhoteraapia alused. Helsingi, Tallinn, Tartu, 1999. Lk. 20-59, 94-109,175-221.

Psychiatry:
1. Michael Gelder, Dennis Gath, Richard Mayou. Concise Oxford Textbook of Psychiatry, 1994, 476 lk.
2. The ICD-10 Classification of Mental and Behavioural Disorders. Clinical descriptions and diagnostic guidelines. WHO,1992, 362 lk.
3. The ICD-10 Classification of Mental and Behavioural Disorders. Diagnostic Criteria for research. WHO,1992, 248 lk.
4. Lexicon of Psychiatric and Mental Health Terms. 2nd ed., WHO, Geneva, 1994, 108 lk.
5. M. Salaspuro, K. Kiianmaa, K. Seppä (toim.). Narkoloogia. Tõlge eesti keelde. Medicina, 2000, 512 lk.
6. J. Saarma. Psühhopatoloogia. Tallinn: Valgus, 1977, 244 lk. (kordustrükk 2000).
7. K. Achté, T. Tamminen. Valvearsti psühhiaatria. (Tõlge eesti keelde) Recallmed, 1994. 311 lk.
8. M.Veldi. Uneraamat. OÜ Lege Artis / Tartu Ülikool, 2009 (elektroonselt http://site.ebrary.com/lib/tartu/search.action?p00=uneraamat&search=Search+ebrary).
9. Femi Oyebode. Psüühilised sümptomid Andrew Simsi käsitluses. Sissejuhatus kirjeldavasse psühhopatoloogiasse. Tartu Ülikooli Kirjastus, 2013, 526 lk
10. http://eprints.utas.edu.au/287/

description.et: Introduction. Classification of mental disorders and psychopathology.
Main causes, prevalence and care management of mental disorders.
Organic mental disorders and mental disorders due to psychoactive substance use.
Psychotic and mood disorders.
Anxiety, somatoform, eating and sleep disorders. Personality disorders.
Mental disorders in children and adolescents I.
Mental disorders in children and adolescents II.
Psychological models of mental disorders.
Principles and schools of psychotherapy.
Psychosomatic disorders.
Therapeutic relationship. Validation skills.
Psychological assessment: cognitive functions and intelligence.
Cognitive-behaviour therapy.
Practicing cognitive-behaviour therapy.
Assessment and psychotherapy with children.
Professional burnout and its prevention. Psychological resilience.
Psychological assessment: emotional state.
Working with psychological trauma.
Cognitive-behavioural therapy of anxiety disorders.
Psychosomatics.
Family therapy.
Psychopathology I.
Psychopathology II. Establishing mental status.

Organic mental disorders: classification, diagnosis (including available assessment methods). Symptomatology: intellectual disabilities and memory disorders, disorders of consciousness. Syndromes: delirium, dementia.
Anxiety and emotional disorders in children and adolescence.
Behavioural disorders in children and adolescents, addictive disorders.
Disorders of cognitive ability and learning disabilities.
Autism. Attachment disorder.
Affective disorders in children and adolescents. Suicidality and self-aggression.
Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.
Obtaining medical history from children. Mental state examination, its peculiarities in children. Hypotheses of diagnosis. Potential schedule of examinations and care plan.
Obtaining medical history from adolescents. Mental state examination, its peculiarities in adolescents. Hypotheses of diagnosis. Potential schedule of examinations and care plan.
Mental disorders due to psychoactive substance use: intoxication, abuse, dependence, withdrawal syndrome.
Schizophrenia: prevalence, etiopathogenesis, symptoms, classification, progression, differential diagnosis from other psychotic disorders.
Emergency psychiatry. Assessment of risk (aggression, impulsivity, etc.), patient management.
Affective disorders: etiopathogenesis, classification. Diagnosis, assessment methods, differential diagnosis.
Suicide. Suicide risk assessment.
Non-psychotic organic mental disorders. Obtaining medical history, mental state examination, differential diagnosis and treatment.
Anxiety and stress-related disorders: epidemiology, etiopathogenesis, classification, clinical manifestations.
Anxiety: diagnosis, comorbidity, treatment.
Treatment of psychotic disorders, including schizophrenia. Antipsychotics. Anxiolytics.
Treatment of affective disorders. Antidepressants and mood stabilizers.

Disturbances of consciousness. Withdrawal state with delirium. Alcohol-induced and psychoactive substance-induced psychosis. Mental state examination, differential diagnosis. Treatment (example of a specific patient).
Alcohol use disorder and drug dependence. Impulse control disorders. Mental state examination, differential diagnosis. Treatment (example of a specific patient).
Interviewing patients with psychosis, assessing the status, diagnosis and differential diagnosis.
Psychotic disorders: symptomatology.
Emergency psychiatric care. Involuntary care.
Social coping and supporting services.
Personality disorders: comorbidity, treatment principles.
Symptomatology of depression, gender- and age-related differences. Interviewing patients with affective disorder, mental state examination.
Symptomatology of affective disorders, interviewing patients, mental state examination, treatment principles. Suicide risk assessment.
Somatoform and dissociative disorders: etiopathogenesis, diagnosis, treatment.
Eating disorders.
Interviewing patients with eating disorders, mental state examination, diagnosis, treatment.
Old-age psychiatry. Clinical manifestations. Differences in management.
Specific features of diagnosis and treatment of mental disorders in the elderly.
Sleep disorders.
Psychological factors and intervention options for addictive disorders.
Mental health act. Psychiatric care management (for adults, children, adolescents). Ethical aspects of psychiatric care. Expert assessments.
Psychological assessment: personality.
